onlineAddresses.caption: Teen Vogue: Black Girl Magik Brings Black Women Together to Spiritually Heal
Shydeia Caldwell | The Know | Oprah Winfrey Network

speakerBioSummary.text:
• Shydeia Caldwell is a healer, writer, and teacher helping people uncover, rediscover and embrace their roots through ancestral lineage healing traditions and education. 
  • Through Black Girl Magik, she uses technology to help Black women enhance and deepen their individual power with wellness, sisterhood, and ancestral healing at its core.
  • Her work addresses global healing by bringing remembrance, connection, and wisdom to institutions of higher learning, Fortune 500 companies, and major media outlets including the Oprah Winfrey Network.
  • She was bestowed the title of "woman of spirit" by her teacher the late Elder Dr. Malidoma Patrice Somé.

speakerBiography.text:
Shydeia Caldwell is a healer, writer, and teacher helping people uncover, rediscover and embrace their roots through ancestral lineage healing traditions and education. At Black Girl Magik, Shydeia uses technology to help Black women enhance and deepen their individual power with wellness, sisterhood, and ancestral healing at its core. Her work has helped thousands of people around the world reconnect to their authenticity, origin, and purpose.

Shydeia's practice is a response to her own journey of unlearning and remembering. Beyond her individual quest, she clears the shadow of history that has blurred society’s relationship to ancestral connection and healing.

The purpose of her work addresses global healing by bringing remembrance, connection, and wisdom to institutions of higher learning, Fortune 500 companies, and major media outlets including the Oprah Winfrey Network. However, her greatest honor was being bestowed the title of "woman of spirit" by her teacher the late Elder Dr. Malidoma Patrice Somé.
